pull.title: test: assumeutxo: check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate
pull.body: Inspired by some manual testing I did for #28553, this PR checks that RPCs which explicitly query the UTXO set database (i.e. `gettxoutsetinfo`, `scantxoutset` and `gettxout`) operate on the snapshot chainstate as expected.

Light code review and manual test.  I concur with the nits from @fjahr.

events.message: test: assumeutxo: check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate

events.body: Thanks for the reviews! Took the suggestions and refined the UTXO check against the `scantxoutset` result to also include the vout index (=0), rather than only verifying the txid.

utACK 917e70a6206c62c4c492fa922425fc8e00d3f328

Only changes since last review were addressing my minor review comments.

ACK 917e70a6206c62c4c492fa922425fc8e00d3f328

These tests are great additions.
Changes incorporate comments nicely.
Ran functionals locally (passed).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -350,6 +350,29 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_equal(loaded['coins_loaded'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
         assert_equal(loaded['base_height'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
 
+        self.log.info("Check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate")
+        # coinstatsindex might be not caught up yet and is not relevant for this test, so don't use it
+        utxo_info = n1.gettxoutsetinfo(use_index=False)
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])
+
+        # find coinbase output at snapshot height on node0 and scan for it on node1,
+        # where the block is not available, but the snapshot was loaded successfully
+        snapshot_hash = loaded['tip_hash']
comments.body: nit: could have moved this up and used it in the `gettxoutsetinfo` as well

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -350,6 +350,29 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_equal(loaded['coins_loaded'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
         assert_equal(loaded['base_height'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
 
+        self.log.info("Check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate")
+        # coinstatsindex might be not caught up yet and is not relevant for this test, so don't use it
+        utxo_info = n1.gettxoutsetinfo(use_index=False)
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])
+
+        # find coinbase output at snapshot height on node0 and scan for it on node1,
+        # where the block is not available, but the snapshot was loaded successfully
+        snapshot_hash = loaded['tip_hash']
+        coinbase_tx = n0.getblock(snapshot_hash, verbosity=2)['tx'][0]
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-1, "Block not found on disk", n1.getblock, snapshot_hash)
+        coinbase_output_descriptor = coinbase_tx['vout'][0]['scriptPubKey']['desc']
+        scan_result = n1.scantxoutset('start', [coinbase_output_descriptor])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['success'], True)
+        assert_equal(scan_result['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])

@@ -350,6 +350,29 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_equal(loaded['coins_loaded'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
         assert_equal(loaded['base_height'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
 
+        self.log.info("Check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate")
+        # coinstatsindex might be not caught up yet and is not relevant for this test, so don't use it
+        utxo_info = n1.gettxoutsetinfo(use_index=False)
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])
+
+        # find coinbase output at snapshot height on node0 and scan for it on node1,
+        # where the block is not available, but the snapshot was loaded successfully
+        snapshot_hash = loaded['tip_hash']
comments.body: On second thought: maybe just pull all three of these loaded keys out in the beginning since you use each of them at least twice and they are used again further below... or you could deduplicate the `assert_equal` triplet but it's not a big deal either way...

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -350,6 +350,29 @@ def run_test(self):
         assert_equal(loaded['coins_loaded'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
         assert_equal(loaded['base_height'], SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT)
 
+        self.log.info("Check that UTXO-querying RPCs operate on snapshot chainstate")
+        # coinstatsindex might be not caught up yet and is not relevant for this test, so don't use it
+        utxo_info = n1.gettxoutsetinfo(use_index=False)
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(utxo_info['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])
+
+        # find coinbase output at snapshot height on node0 and scan for it on node1,
+        # where the block is not available, but the snapshot was loaded successfully
+        snapshot_hash = loaded['tip_hash']
+        coinbase_tx = n0.getblock(snapshot_hash, verbosity=2)['tx'][0]
+        assert_raises_rpc_error(-1, "Block not found on disk", n1.getblock, snapshot_hash)
+        coinbase_output_descriptor = coinbase_tx['vout'][0]['scriptPubKey']['desc']
+        scan_result = n1.scantxoutset('start', [coinbase_output_descriptor])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['success'], True)
+        assert_equal(scan_result['txouts'], loaded['coins_loaded'])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['height'], loaded['base_height'])
+        assert_equal(scan_result['bestblock'], loaded['tip_hash'])
+        assert coinbase_tx['txid'] in [coin['txid'] for coin in scan_result['unspents']]
comments.body: nit: Would be a bit more readable IMO if you would break it into two lines

comments.body: Introduced `snapshot_hash` and `snapshot_num_coins` in the beginning and used the already existing `SNAPSHOT_BASE_HEIGHT` for the height.
